definitions.definition: A sedimentary deposit , especially in urine .
The essential person , specifically the single person of Christ (as distinguished from his two ‘natures’, human and divine), or of the three ‘persons’ of the Trinity (sharing a single ‘essence’).
The underlying reality or substance of something.

subdefinitions.definition: A relationship between a name and a known quantity , as a cultural personification (i.e. objectification with personality ) of an entity or quality .

Referring to the hypostatic model of personality; i.e., asserting that humans present themselves in many different aspects or hypostases , depending on the internal and external realities they relate to, including different approaches to the study of personality .

definitions.definition: The effect of one gene preventing another from expressing .

main_definition: ( medicine , now historical ) A sedimentary deposit , especially in urine . [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( theology ) The essential person , specifically the single person of Christ (as distinguished from his two ‘natures’, human and divine), or of the three ‘persons’ of the Trinity (sharing a single ‘essence’). [from 16th c.]
( philosophy ) The underlying reality or substance of something. [from 17th c.]
( genetics ) The effect of one gene preventing another from expressing . [from 20th c.]
